definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: All of us hunger-struck last time.
sentences.chinese: 上次我們全都參加了絕食抗議運動。

sentences.english: Because Fang Qiong cheated money, face on Monday, a hunger strike at home.
sentences.chinese: 方瓊因爲被騙了錢，面子上下不來，在家絕食抗議。

sentences.english: Mr. Hazare launched his first hunger strike, a five-day fast, in April.
sentences.chinese: 哈扎爾於今年4月首次發起爲其5天的絕食抗議。

sentences.english: There are at least three students around the world also on hunger strike.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地至少還有三個學生也在進行絕食抗議。

sentences.english: The Balkars went on a hunger strike already about 4 months ago.
sentences.chinese: 大約4個月前巴耳卡爾人就已經開始進行絕食抗議了。

sentences.english: Some students have been staging a hunger-strike at Memorial Hall.
sentences.chinese: 有羣學生一直待在紀念堂絕食抗議。

sentences.english: Did you hear about the guy who almost died during a hunger strike?
sentences.chinese: 你有聽說那個在絕食抗議中差點餓死的人嗎？

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: the critical moment/life and death crisis
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
